articles.author: Lenin Ndebele
articles.title: Memory lane: We look at some of the good that came out of Africa in 2022 - News24
articles.description: As the year 2022 draws to a close in less than 48 hours, in Africa, it was not all gloom as there were many feel-good developments across the continent.
articles.content:
• Morocco became the first African country to reach the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup.
  • Kenya and Lesotho's smooth transition of power set an example for democracy.
  • The Afric… [+4946 chars]

articles.title: Big cuts in petrol, diesel prices expected next week - News24
articles.description: After a tough year of rocketing fuel costs, South Africans will start 2023 with large price cuts expected on Wednesday.
articles.content:
After a tough year of rocketing fuel costs, South Africans will start 2023 with large price cuts expected on Wednesday.

articles.author: Pete Syme
articles.title: Elon Musk responds to Twitter's first widespread outage under his leadership by saying it works for him - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: Elon Musk told Twitter users: "Works for me" after the platform went down for thousands. Staff previously raised outage concerns after mass layoffs.
articles.content:
On Wednesday, Twitter suffered its first widespread outage since Elon Musk took over the platform. 
Downdetector saw around 10,000 people submit problem report. Issues were reported in several count… [+1770 chars]

articles.title: 41 flights hit by refuelling problem at OR Tambo on Thursday - News24
articles.description: Airports Company South Africa says that refuelling challenges resulted in delays for domestic and international departures on Thursday.
articles.content:
Airports Company South Africa (ACSA) says that challenges with refuelling of aircraft impacted 41 flights at OR Tambo International Airport on Thursday.

articles.author: Lenin Ndebele
articles.title: RECAP | How the war in Ukraine played out for Africa - News24
articles.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine this year thrust Africa into the centre of a divided world where the continent had to carefully choose which side they were on.
articles.content:
• Judging by UN voting, Africa was less keen on supporting the condemnation of Russia.
  • Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky had a tough time drawing attention from African leaders.
